intro: Casearia glaberrima, commonly known as the white casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in tropical gardens.
